column1: 2 ^ Ēructāvit cor meum verbum bonum; dīcō egō opera mea rēgī. Lingua mea calamus scrībae
column2: vēlōciter scrībentis. ^ My heart hath uttered a good word; I speak my works to the king. My tongue is the pen of a scrivener that writeth swiftly.
diffūsa est grātia in labiīs tuīs; proptereā benedīxit tē Deus in aeternum. ^ Thou art beautiful above the sons of men
column3: grace is poured abroad in thy lips; therefore hath God blessed thee for ever.

column1: 4 ^ Accingere gladiō tuō super femur tuum
column2: potentissime. ^ Gird thy sword upon thy thigh

column1: 5 ^ Speciē tuā et pulchritūdine tuā intende
column4: propter vēritātem et mansuētūdinem et jūstitiam
column5: et dēdūcet tē mīrābiliter dextera tua. ^ With thy comeliness and thy beauty set out
column8: because of truth and meekness and justice
column9: and thy right hand shall conduct thee wonderfully.

column1: 6 ^ Sagittae tuae acūtae; populī sub tē cadent
column2: in corda inimīcōrum rēgis. ^ Thy arrows are sharp; under thee shall people fall
column3: into the hearts of the king's enemies.
in saeculum saeculī; virga dīrēctiōnis virga regnī tuī. ^ Thy throne
column5: is forever and ever; the sceptre of thy kingdom is a sceptre of uprightness.

column2: et ōdistī inīquitātem; proptereā ūnxit tē Deus
column3: Deus tuus oleō laetitiae prae consortibus tuīs. ^ Thou hast loved justice
column6: hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

column1: 9 ^ Murra et gutta et cassia ā vestīmentīs tuīs
column7: from these they have delighted thee;

column1: 10 ^ fīliae rēgum in honōre tuō; astitit rēgīna ā dextrīs tuīs in vestītū dēaurātō
column2: circumdatā varietāte. ^ the daughters of kings in thy glory; the queen stood on thy right hand in gilded clothing

column5: et oblīvīscere populum tuum et domum patris tuī. ^ Hearken
column9: and forget thy people and thy father's house.

column2: quoniam ipse est Dominus Deus tuus
column3: et adōrābunt eum. ^ And the king shall greatly desire thy beauty
column4: for he is the Lord thy God

column1: 13 ^ Et fīliae Tīrī in mūneribus vultum tuum dēprecābuntur; omnēs dīvitēs plēbis. ^ And the daughters of Tyre hall entreat thy countenance with gifts; all the rich among the people.
14 ^ Omnis glōria ejus fīliae rēgis ab intus
column3: circumamicta varietātibus. ^ All the glory of the daughter of the king is within

column1: 15 ^ Addūcentur rēgī virginēs post eam; proximae ejus afferentur tibī. ^ After her shall virgins be brought to the king; her neighbours shall be brought to thee.
16 ^ Afferentur in laetitiā et exsultātiōne; addūcentur in templum rēgis. ^ They shall be brought with gladness and rejoicing; they shall be brought into the temple of the king.
17 ^ Prō patribus tuīs nātī sunt tibī fīliī; constituēs eōs prīncipēs super omnem terram. ^ Instead of thy fathers
column2: sons are born to thee; thou shalt make them princes over all the earth.

column1: 18 ^ Memorēs erunt nōminis tuī in omnī generātiōne et generātiōnem. Proptereā populī confitēbuntur tibī in aeternum
column2: et in saeculum saeculī. ^ They shall remember thy name throughout all generations. Therefore shall people praise thee for ever
